snippet: Mr. Kuczynski, a former prime minister, held a narrow advantage over Ms. Fujimori, the daughter of a former president, as officials said they would keep counting votes.
abstract: Pedro-Pablo Kuczynski, economist and former prime minister of Peru, holds slim lead over Keiko Fujimori in presidential election.

byline.original: By ANDREA ZARATE and NICHOLAS CASEY
byline.contributor: Andrea Zarate reported from Lima, and Nicholas Casey from New York. Frances Robles contributed reporting from Miami.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Kuczynski, a former prime minister, held a narrow advantage over Ms. Fujimori, the daughter of a former president, as officials said they would keep counting votes.

headline.main: Pedro Kuczynski Holds Thin Lead Over Keiko Fujimori in Peru Presidential Election
headline.print_headline: Economist Holds Thin Lead in Peru’s Presidential Vote
